content.question: The rhythm of the opening melody played by the flute is most accurately notated as

choices.label:
Two measures of rhythms notated in three-four.
-	Measure 1 is quarter rest, dotted eighth rest, sixteenth note, dotted eighth note, and sixteenth note.
-	Measure 2 is quarter note, dotted eighth note, sixteenth note, dotted eighth note, and sixteenth note.

Two measures of rhythms notated in three-four.
-	Measure 1 is quarter rest, eighth rest, and three eighth notes.
-	Measure 2 is a quarter note and four eighth notes.

Two measures of rhythms notated in three-four.
-	Measure 1 is quarter rest, dotted quarter note, and an eighth note.
-	Measure 2 is a dotted quarter note and three eighth notes.

Two measures of rhythms notated in three-four.
-	Measure 1 is eighth rest, eight note tied to an eighth note, and an eighth note tied to an eighth note. 
-	The final eighth note in measure 1 is tied to the first eighth note in measure 2.
-	Measure 2 continues with two eighth notes tied together, two eighth notes tied together, and a single eighth note.

content.answer:
Two measures of rhythms notated in three-four.
-	Measure 1 is quarter rest, dotted eighth rest, sixteenth note, dotted eighth note, and sixteenth note.
-	Measure 2 is quarter note, dotted eighth note, sixteenth note, dotted eighth note, and sixteenth note.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
